summary: The Special District Fairness and Accessibility Act aims to ensure special districts are recognized as local governments for federal financial assistance. The bill directs the Office of Management and Budget (OMB) to issue guidance to agencies on recognizing special districts. Agencies must then implement this guidance within a year. The OMB is also required to report on agency compliance to relevant congressional committees within two years. The bill defines key terms like "special district" and "federal financial assistance".
